description: List of lessons of talkenglish.com, it was scraped from http://www.talkenglish.com/lessonindex.aspx for personal use

categories.title: Data Structures and Algorithms
categories.description: This section is created for English speaking beginners who need help to understand the basics of speaking English.  We will use very simple phrases and expressions to help you with your English speaking.There are currently 90 lessons with over 900 audio files in the English Speaking Basics Section.  Once you are familiar with the basics of English speaking, you can move to other categories such as Regular English Lessons

sections.title: Array
sections.description: English Speaking Basics is for English speaking beginners who need help to understand the basics of speaking English.  We will use very simple phrases and expressions to help you with your English speaking.This first section contains the first 30 lessons.  Go through them 1 by 1 until you are familiar with each sentence.

sections.title: Linked List
sections.description: English Speaking Basics II is for English speaking beginners who need help to understand the basics of speaking English.  We will use very simple phrases and expressions to help you with your English speaking.This second section contains the next 30 lessons.  If any lessons are too easy, please move forward to other lessons.

lessons.title: It occurred to me that (subject + verb)

sections.title: String
sections.description: English Speaking Basics III is for English speaking beginners who need help to understand the basics of speaking English.  We will use very simple phrases and expressions to help you with your English speaking.This third section contains the next 30 lessons.  Please continue studying until you master each lesson.

lessons.title: If I were you, I would + (verb)
How much does it cost to + (verb)
It's very kind of you to + (verb)

categories.title: System Design
categories.description: Regular English lessons contain key sentences for many different scenarios that are used in everyday life. This daily English section will help you because all the sentences are everyday sentences that are regularly used.You don't have to worry about studying English sentences that are not used in everyday use.

sections.title: Greeting and General Things
sections.description: Greetings and General Things section contains basic English lessons on Greetings, communicating when you're bored, past, present, and future tense, and the weather.Review and study them as many times as you want.

lessons.title: How is your Day - General Statements
How is your day - Example Conversation
How is your day - Interactive Practice
Tomorrow's Plan - I am going to
Yesterday - The Past - Questions and Answers

sections.title: Greeting and General Things II
sections.description: Greetings and General Things II section contains basic English lessons on Small Talk, Favorite Things, Hobbies, Movies, and Exercising.Review and study them as many times as you want.

lessons.title: Intro and General Things Review - Interactive Practice

sections.title: College Related Topics
sections.description: College Related Topics section contains basic English lessons on University Life, University Classes, Examinations, and Roommates.Review and study them as many times as you want.

lessons.title: University Life - More Q and As

sections.title: College Related Topics II
sections.description: College Related Topics II section contains basic English lessons on topics related to College life. This section will focus on Fraternity and Sorority, College Partying, Smoking and Drinking.Review and study them as many times as you want.

lessons.title: Smoking - Asking for Light and Hate Smoking
College Related Topics Review - Interactive Practice

lessons.title: Body Parts - Leg and Head Area

lessons.title: Engagement - Best man and Maid of honor
Wedding Process - Photographer, Dress and Tux
Married Life - Talking about a Friend

lessons.title: Talking About Girls - Types You Like or Dislike
Talking About Girls - In Love and Body Parts you like

lessons.title: Guys - Girls - and Sports Review - Interactive Practice

lessons.title: Happy and Feeling Good - Other Sentences
Happy and Feeling Good - Interactive Practice
Being Worried - Talking to a Worried Person

lessons.title: Sad or Depressed - Doctor and Friend
Love - Friend and Husband and Wife

sections.title: Family - Children - Friends
sections.description: The Family and Friends section will provide many English lessons on a variety of topics such as eating together, shopping for groceries, day care for children, having pets, and other topics related to general family and friends topics.Review and study them as many times as you want.

sections.title: Family - Children - Friends II
sections.description: The Family and Friends II section will provide many English lessons on a variety of topics such as school for kids, family health care, family vacations, pregnancy, and other topics related to general family and friends topics.Review and study them as many times as you want.

categories.title: Computer Network
categories.description: This section is created for English speaking beginners who need help to understand the basics of speaking English.

sections.title: Fundamentals
sections.description: A large number of separate but interconnected computers do the job. These systems are called computer networks

sections.title: Network Security
sections.description: Security is a broad topic and covers a multitude of sins.

lessons.title: Cut the cable and fork it
There are tons of places to attack a network
Why are complex systems hard to protect?
Data is encrypted at intermediate sources
Is unencrypted by intermediate sources and exposed then reencrypted

categories.title: Mock Interview
categories.description: There are over a hundred questions and several hundred answers to study. Each Interview question is listed below each subcategory. Within each lesson, you will find the question and several different ways of answering, along with an explanation.Use the audio files to listen to a native English speaker and improve your interview skills while improving your English speaking.

sections.title: Basic Interview Questions I
sections.description: Interview Basics contain Interview English lessons on Commonly used Interview Questions and Answers such as What are you Weaknesses and your Strengths.Review and study them as many times as you want.

lessons.title: Tell me a little about yourself.
What are your short term goals?
What are your long term goals?
What do you want to be doing five years from now?
If you could change one thing about your personality, what would it be...
What does success mean to you?
What does failure mean to you?
In what ways are you organized and disorganized?
Do you manage your time well?
How do you make important decisions?
Do you work well under pressure?

sections.title: Basic Interview Questions II
sections.description: Basic Interview Questions II contain Interview English lessons related to Experience through Scenario Questions such as Tell me about...Review and study them as many times as you want.

lessons.title: Are you better at anticipating or reacting to problems
Are you a risk taker or do you like to stay away from risks?
Tell me about Q's... / Tell me about a time you made a mistake.
Tell me about a time you made a good decision.
Tell me about a time you made a poor decision.
Tell me about a time you fired someone.
Tell me about a time you hired someone.
Tell me about a time you failed to complete an assignment on time.
Tell me about a time you found a solution to save the company money.
Tell me about a time you aimed too high.
Tell me about a time you aimed too low.
Tell me about a time you made a great sale.
Tell me about a time you went over budget.

sections.title: School Related Interview Q's
sections.description: School Related Questions contain Interview English lessons related to your Activities and Accomplishments while in College.Review and study them as many times as you want.

lessons.title: What extracurricular activities were you involved in?
Why did you choose your major?
If you redo college again, what would you major in?
What course did you like the most?
What course did you like the least?
How will your performance in your worst class affect your performance...
How would your best friend describe you?
How would your professor describe you?
How would your mother describe you?
Why are you applying for a job that you didn’t major in?
During college, how did you spend your summer vacations?
What did you learn from your internship?
If you could learn something such as a new skill, what would it be?

sections.title: Work Related Interview Q's I
sections.description: Work Related Questions contain Interview English lessons on General Work Experience, Management Philosophy, Why you are leaving your current job, etc.Review and study them as many times as you want.

lessons.title: If you could start your career over again, what would you do differently?
During your performance reviews, what criticism do you hear the most?
Tell me about your last three positions?
Tell me about your last position?
Tell me about the best manager you ever had.
Tell me about the worst manager you ever had.
What could you have done to improve your relationship with a manager...
What were the most memorable accomplishments in your last position?
Why do you want to leave your current job?
Where did you tell your boss you were going?
Are you currently employed at the last place listed on your resume?
What is the title of the person you report to?
In your previous position, how much time did you spend ...
If you don’t leave your current job, what do you imagine you will be doing...
If you’re very happy with your current job, why do you want to leave?

sections.title: Work Related Interview Q's II
sections.description: Work Related Questions II contain Interview English lessons on General Work Related Questions such as Why do you like Sales.Review and study them as many times as you want.

lessons.title: If you have problems or complaints with your current job, why haven’t you...
Give me a specific example at your last position where...
What do you feel an employer owes an employee?
What do you expect from your manager?
Would you like to have your boss’s job?
What did you hear about us?
What do you know about our product?
Have you managed people in any of the positions you’ve held?
What types of people do you have trouble getting along with?
Who do you think are our two major competitors?
Do you see that stapler? Convince me to buy it.
How long have you been looking for a job?
Why haven’t you received any offers so far?
If you don’t understand your assignment and you can’t reach your boss...

sections.title: Work Related Interview Q's III
sections.description: Work Related Questions III contain Interview English lessons on Morals, Criticism, and Scenario Questions such as What do you do when you feel burned out.Review and study them as many times as you want.

lessons.title: If everyone on the team is a veteran, what will you do to fit in?
How do you intend to learn what you need to know to perform well for...
If your supervisor tells you to do something that you believe can be done...
If you’re told to do something that you feel is illegal, what would you do?
If you were unfairly criticized, what would you do?
What are you looking to gain from your next job?
What aspects of this job interest you the most?
If you are given work from your manager that is boring and tedious, what...
How long do you plan on staying with this company?
How do you explain the fact that you frequently change jobs?
Tell me about a time you had a big disagreement with your boss.
What do you do when there is no work to do?
What do you do when there are too many things to do?
What do you do when you feel burned out?
How do you balance both your family and your job?
You’ve been with one company your entire career. Don’t you think you will...
What have you heard about our company that you didn’t like?
Do you want to work for a small or large company and why?

sections.title: Working with People Interview Q's
sections.description: Working with People Questions contain Interview English lessons on Working with People such as what you would do if you have a problem working with someone.Review and study them as many times as you want.

lessons.title: What do you do when you’re having difficulty solving a problem?
What do you do when you have a problem with a direct?
What do you do when you have a problem with your boss?
What do you do when you have a problem with your job?
What do you do when you have a problem with a co-worker?
What do you do when a worker is giving the team more problems then...
When do you know enough is enough when dealing with a subordinate...
Do you like to work by yourself or with others?

sections.title: Miscellaneous Interview Q's
sections.description: Miscellaneous Questions contain Interview English lessons on a Variety of Different Questions such as your work hour preference, pay, books, etc.Review and study them as many times as you want.

lessons.title: Do you have any physical problems that may limit your ability to perform...
What do you do to stay in shape?
What do you like to do when you’re not in the office?
What’s the most recent book you read?
What is the most recent movie you saw?
Did you have any trouble finding this place?
Will working on weekends be a problem?
How do you feel about overtime?
Do you own or rent your home?
Do you have any outside income?
Do you earn any income from investments or hobbies?
May I contact your current employer?
Is there anything else you want to add?
What kind of salary are you looking for?
That’s a high salary for this position! Where did you come up with that...
How much do you currently get paid?
When are you able to start?
Are you considering any other offers right now?
